alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Johnston (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 7:33AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Johnston, southwestern Coal and west central Atoka Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 731 AM CDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a thin line from near Mill Creek to Wapanucka, moving southeast at 20 mph. Locally heavy rainfall will also occur with these storms. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tishomingo, Wapanucka, Mill Creek, Milburn, Bromide, Connerville, Pontotoc, Coleman, Fillmore, and Reagan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding.
